description.en: This process models the hydrological behaviour of La Tordera Basin from 2000 to 2022 using SWAT+ ( https://swat.tamu.edu/). The default tool settings generate daily outputs of flow, water temperature, and nutrient levels at the mouth of La Tordera River between July 2019 and December 2020, allowing for an assessment of river flow parameters during Storm Gloria (19 January 2020). The model is calibrated through a two-step calibration process: an initial soft calibration based on a qualitative evaluation of annual average outputs, followed by an automatic calibration by landscape units using observed gauge data from the Catalan Water Agency (Agència Catalana de l'Aigua, https://aca.gencat.cat/). Final parameter calibration values: XXXXXXX. The model is executed using SWATrunR ( https://github.com/chrisschuerz/SWATplusR ) with the SWAT+ rev60.5.7_64rel_linux executable.

links.title: How to use a OGC processing service with R
How to use a OGC processing service with python

unit.title: Output Spatial unit
unit.description: Define the spatial unit for which to generate an output. Spatial unit refers to river section, HRU, or LSU as defined by La Tordera watershed delineation in (LINK TO WATERSHED MAP). Defaults to: 1.

file.title: SWAT Output File
file.description: A SWAT+ output file name consists of three elements separated by underscores (_): spatial unit, output category, and time step. For example, 'channel_sd_day'. The spatial unit defines the scale of the output and can be basin, hru, lsunit, channel, aquifer, or reservoir. The output category specifies the type of data: wb (water balance), nb (nutrient balance), ls (losses), pw (plant and weather), or sd (streamflow and sediment in channels). The time step indicates the temporal resolution and can be day (daily), mon (monthly), yr (yearly), or aa (annual average). Combining these elements forms the output file name. Galaxy platform will offer a subset of the most common outputs. For more details and extended capabilities, refer to the SWAT+ OUTPUT FILES section in the SWAT+ documentation (https://swatplus.gitbook.io/io-docs). Defaults to: (TODO AMANDA).

variable.title: SWAT Variable
variable.description: Variable to simulate. Example: 'flo_out'. Galaxy platform will offer a subset of the most common variable outputs. For more details and extended capabilities, refer to the SWAT+ OUTPUT FILES section in the SWAT+ documentation (https://swatplus.gitbook.io/io-docs). Defaults to: (TODO AMANDA).

start_date.title: Start date
start_date.description: (optional) Start date of the simulation in the format yyyymmdd. Defaults to: 20160101. Earliest possible date: 20000101.

start_date_print.title: Start date
start_date_print.description: (optional) Start date for printing in the format yyyymmdd. Defaults to: 20190601. Earliest possible date: 20020101. It is recommended to allow for at least two warm-up years between the model simulation start and the model output printing to ensure relevant results

end_date.title: End date
end_date.description: (optional) End date of the simulation in the format yyyymmdd. Defaults to: 20201231. Latest possible date: 20221231.

parameter_calibration.title: Parameter Calibration
parameter_calibration.description: (Optional) SWAT model parameter adjustments. Default values are obtained through a two-step calibration process: an initial soft calibration based on a qualitative evaluation of annual average outputs, followed by an automatic calibration by landscape units using observed gauge data from the Catalan Water Agency (Agència Catalana de l'Aigua, https://aca.gencat.cat/). For more details, refer to the SWAT+ documentation ( https://swatplus.gitbook.io/io-docs) and the SWATrunR documentation ( https://chrisschuerz.github.io/SWATrunR/). Defaults to: (TODO Amanda).

swat_output_file.title: Variable Simulation
swat_output_file.description: A CSV file containing simulated values for the specified time range and time step (daily, monthly, yearly, or annual average). Default output files include: channel flow out in m3 (flow_out.csv), water temperature Degrees Celcius (water_temp.csv), nitrate nitrogen leaving the channel in kg (no3_out.csv), and soluble phosphorus leaving the channel in kg (solp_out.csv).
